member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.FindCharacterSREngines(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Objects that meet a specific character's requirements.
member.param: A string value that specifies the character file, or an empty string for the default character.
An optional numeric value that specifies the language to match, or zero to match any language.
member.returns: A Collection that matches the character's text-to-speech requirements and the specified (if any).

remarks.para: This method allows you to choose a speech recognition engine without loading the character.
For more information on specifying character file names, see the method.
remarks.note: This method does not support the HTTP protocol for character files.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.FindCharacterTTSEngines(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Objects that meet a specific character's requirements.
member.param: A string value that specifies the character file, or an empty string for the default character.
An optional numeric value that specifies the language to match, or zero to match any language.
member.returns: A Collection that matches the character's text-to-speech requirements and the specified (if any).

remarks.para: This method allows you to choose a text-to-speech engine without loading the character.
For more information on specifying character file names, see the method.
remarks.note: This method does not support the HTTP protocol for character files.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.FindSREngines(System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Objects for a specific language.
member.param: A numeric value that specifies the language to match, or zero for any language.
member.returns: A Collection that matches the the specified .

remarks.para: This method allows you to query available speech recognition engines without loading a character.
remarks.note: Using this method with zero for the is equivalent to using the property.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.FindTTSEngines(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of Objects for a specific language and gender.
member.param: A numeric value that specifies the language to match, or zero for any language.

A numeric value, or a member of the Enumeration, that specifies the gender to match:
1 = Female
A female voice.
2 = Male
A male voice.
0 = Neutral
Either a female or male voice.
member.returns: A Collection that matches the the specified and .

remarks.para: This method allows you to query available text-to-speech engines without loading a character.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.GetCharacterSREngine(System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a Object that meets a specific character's requirements.
member.param: A string value that specifies the character file, or an empty string for the default character.
member.returns: The Object that matches the character's speech recognition requirements (if any).

remarks.para: This method allows you to query a character's default speech recognition engine without loading the character.
For more information on specifying character file names, see the method.
remarks.note: This method does not support the HTTP protocol for character files.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.GetCharacterTTSEngine(System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves a Object that meets a specific character's requirements.
member.param: A string value that specifies the character file, or an empty string for the default character.
member.returns: The Object that matches the character's text-to-speech requirements (if any).

remarks.para: This method allows you to query a character's default text-to-speech engine without loading the character.
For more information on specifying character file names, see the method.
remarks.note: This method does not support the HTTP protocol for character files.

member.name: M:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.ShowDefaultCharacterProperties(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Shows the Gallery page of the Advanced Character Options window.
member.param: The horizontal position, in pixels, of the window. This parameter is optional. For programming languages that don't support optional parameters, a negative value will be ignored.
The vertical position, in pixels, of the window. This parameter is optional. For programming languages that don't support optional parameters, a negative value will be ignored.

remarks.para: This method is obsolete, but is still supported for backward compatibility. Calling it shows the Advanced Character Options window. New applications should use the Object instead.
If you don't specify the and coordinates (or use a negative value for programming languages that don't support optional parameters), the window appears at the last location it was displayed.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.AudioOutput
member.summary: deprecated

remarks.para: This property has been replaced by the property, but is still supported for backward compatibility.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.AutoConnect
member.summary: Specifies if the Double Agent control will automatically connect to the Double Agent server.
member.value:
A numeric value specifying whether automatic connection is enabled.
On a 32-bit system:
0 The control will not automatically connect to the server.
Any non-zero value The control will automatically connect to the server.
On a 64-bit system:
0 The control will not automatically connect to the server.
32 The control will automatically connect to the 32-bit server. If the 32-bit server is not installed, the 64-bit server will be used.
64 The control will automatically connect to the 64-bit server. If the 64-bit server is not installed, the 32-bit server will be used.
Any other non-zero value The control will automatically connect to server with the same architecture as the calling process. If the matching server is not installed, then the other server will be used.

remarks.para: If this property is non-zero, then the control will automatically establish a connection with the server the first time it's required. To use the control in stand-alone mode, you must set this property to zero.
For compatibility with Microsoft® Agent, the default value for this property is True.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlAutoSize
member.summary: Specifies if the ActiveX® control is automatically sized to fit the .
member.value: A boolean value that specifies if the control's size is automatically adjusted to exactly fit the .

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlBackColor
member.summary: Specifies the ActiveX® control's background color.
member.value: An System.Drawing.Color value for the control's background color.

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlBorderColor
member.summary: Specifies the ActiveX® control's border color.
member.value: An System.Drawing.Color value for the control's border color.

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style of the ActiveX® control's border.
member.value:
A numeric value that specifies the border style as follows:
0 = Default The default border style (default for the target environment)
1 = FixedSingle A fixed-width single line of width and color

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlBorderVisible
member.summary: Specifies if the ActiveX® control's has a visible border.
member.value: An boolean value that indicates if the border is visible.

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlBorderWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the ActiveX® control's border.
member.value: An numeric value that specifies the border width, in pixels.

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlMousePointer
member.summary: Specifies the pointer to show when the mouse moves over the ActiveX® control.
member.value:
A numeric value that specifies the pointer style as follows:
0 = Default The default pointer style (default for the target environment)
1 = Arrow The arrow-shaped pointer
2 = Cross The cross-shaped pointer
11 = Hourglass The "wait" pointer
12 = No Drop The pointer that indicates that drag-and-drop is not possible here
13 = Arrow and Hourglass The pointer that indicates that an application is starting
14 = Arrow and Question The pointer used for "What's this?" help
16 = Hand The hand-shaped pointer

remarks.note: This property is relevant only when the control is visible (i.e. when it's used in contained mode).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CharacterFiles
member.summary: Returns the control's Object.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.Characters
member.summary: Returns the control's Collection.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CharacterStyle
member.summary: Specifies the initial style to use when a is loaded.
member.value:
A numeric bit-field value that specifies the to apply when a is loaded:
&H00000001 = SoundEffects
The animation sound effects are played.
&H00000002 = IdleEnabled
The character enters idle mode and shows it's idling animations when it's not doing anything else.
&H00000004 = AutoPopupMenu
A right-click on the character or it's notification icon automatically shows a pop-up menu.
&H00000008 = IconShown
The character has a notification icon in the taskbar notification area.
&H00000020 = SmoothEdges
Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the edges of the character's animations.
&H00000030 = Smoothed
Image smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to the character's animations.
&H00000100 = SuspendPause
All requests are paused when the client is not in the foreground.
&H00000200 = SuspendStop
All requests are stopped when the client is not in the foreground.
&H00000400 = SuspendHide
All floating windows are hidden when the client is not in the foreground.

remarks.para: Setting this property allows you to establish a default . for you application. It's initial value is , , , .

The and flags can only be changed here. Once a is loaded, these bits cannot be changed in it's property. Also, these two settings are only used the first time the character is loaded. If another client has already loaded the character, it's smoothing settings will not change. If your client application is the first client to load the character, then your smoothing settings will apply to all clients.
remarks.note: For compatibility with Microsoft® Agent, the flag is set by default. To load a without showing it's notification icon, set the flag off.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CommandsWindow
member.summary: Returns the control's Object.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.Connected
member.summary: Specifies if the control is currently connected to the Double Agent server. The Double Agent control will work whether or not it's connected to the server, but there are are special considerations in each case. See Connected, Stand-Alone, and Contained for more information.
member.value: A boolean value specifying whether the control is connected.

remarks.para: You can manually open or close the connection to the server by changing the Connected property. When the connection state changes, any characters you've loaded are automatically unloaded. If you still have references to any objects except the control itself, any attempt to access the objects' properties or methods will fail.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.ControlCharacter
member.summary: Specifies the control's contained character.
member.value: The Object object that's contained within the visible area of the control, or an empty reference (Nothing).

remarks.para: Setting the ControlCharacter property to a Object changes the control from stand-alone mode to contained mode. Setting ControlCharacter to an empty reference changes the control from contained mode back to stand-alone mode.

Normally, the control isn't visible at runtime, but when it has a ControlCharacter it will become visible as a child window of its containing form. This is the only time the ActiveX® appearance properties, such as and , are used.
remarks.note: You cannot set the ControlCharacter property if the control is to the server.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.PropertySheet
member.summary: Returns the control's Object.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.RaiseRequestErrors
member.summary: Specifies if an error condition is raised (an exception thrown) for failed requests.
member.value: A boolean value that determines whether errors are raised for failed requests. The default value is True.

remarks.para: When a method that returns a Object fails, there are two ways to detect the error. If RaiseRequestErrors is set, the Double Agent control will raise an error condition. If it's not set, you can check the Object's property. An example of a request error is when you specify an animation name that doesn't exist for the method.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.Settings
member.summary: Returns the control's Object.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlActivateInput
member.summary: Signalled when a client becomes input-active.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that has become input-active.

remarks.para: The input-active client receives mouse and speech input events for the character. Double Agent sends this event only to the client that becomes input-active.

This event can occur when the user uses your Collection, for example, by choosing a Collection entry in the Voice Commands window or in the pop-up menu window for a character. It can also occur when the user selects a character (by clicking or speaking its name), when a character becomes visible, or when the character of another client application becomes hidden.

You can also call the method with set to 2 () to explicitly make the character topmost, which results in your client application becoming input-active and triggers this event. However, this event does not occur if you use the method only to specify whether or not your client is the active client of the character.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlActivateInputEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlActiveClientChange
member.summary: Signalled when the active client of the character changes.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that has become active or inactive.
True if the character has become the active client or False if it's no longer the active client.

remarks.para: When multiple clients ( instances) share the same character, the active client of the character receives mouse input (for example, click or drag events). Similarly, when multiple characters are displayed, the active client of the topmost character (also known as the input-active client) receives events.

A client application may receive this event when the user selects one of the client's entries in the character's pop-up menu or by voice command, when the client application changes its active status, or when another client terminates.
Double Agent sends this event only to the clients that are directly affected; that either become the active client or stop being the active client.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlActiveClientChangeEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.param: The source of the event.
An EventArgs object that contains no event data.

remarks.para: This event indicates that the user has changed and applied any property in the Advanced Character Options window. You can use the Object to query the specific property settings.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlAgentPropertyChangeEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlBookmarkEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlClick
member.summary: Signalled when the user clicks a character, or the character's notification icon.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was clicked.
A numeric value that identifies which mouse button was pressed and released to cause the event. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the left button (bit 0) (&H0001), right button (bit 1) (&H0002), and middle button (bit 2) (&H0004). Only one of the bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. If the character has a notification icon, and bit 13 (&H1000) is also set, the click occurred on the notification icon.
A numeric value that corresponds to the state of the Shift, Ctrl, and Alt keys when the mouse button was pressed or released. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the Shift key (bit 0) (&H0001), the Ctrl key (bit 1) (&H0002), and the Alt key (bit 2) (&H0004). A bit is set if the key is down. Some, all, or none of the bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the keys are down. For example, if both Ctrl and Alt were down, the value of would be 6.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user clicks a character or its notification icon with no input-active client, Double Agent sends the event to its active client. If the character is visible ( is True), the user's action also sets the character's current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the CtlClick event. If the character is hidden ( is False), and the user clicks the character's notification icon using button 1, the character is also automatically shown.
remarks.note: Clicking a character does not disable all other character output. However, pressing the Listening key does flush the input-active character's output and triggers the event, passing a that indicates that the client's queue was interrupted.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlCommand
member.summary: Signalled when the user chooses a (client's) command.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event when your application is input-active and the user chooses a command from the character's pop-up menu, or by spoken input.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlCommandEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlDblClick
member.summary: Signalled when the user double-clicks a character.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was double-clicked.
A numeric value that identifies which mouse button was pressed and released to cause the event. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the left button (bit 0) (&H0001), right button (bit 1) (&H0002), and middle button (bit 2) (&H0004). Only one of the bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. If the character has a notification icon, and bit 13 (&H1000) is also set, the click occurred on the notification icon.
A numeric value that corresponds to the state of the Shift, Ctrl, and Alt keys when the mouse button was pressed or released. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the Shift key (bit 0) (&H0001), the Ctrl key (bit 1) (&H0002), and the Alt key (bit 2) (&H0004). A bit is set if the key is down. Some, all, or none of the bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the keys are down. For example, if both Ctrl and Alt were down, the value of would be 6.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user double-clicks a character or its notification icon with no input-active client, Double Agent sends the event to its active client. If the character is visible ( is True), the user's action also sets the character's current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the CtlDblClick event. If the character is hidden ( is False), and the user double-clicks the character's notification icon using button 1, the character is also automatically shown.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlDblClickEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlDeactivateInput
member.summary: Signalled when a client becomes non-input-active.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that has become non-input-active.

remarks.para: A non-input-active client no longer receives mouse or speech events from Double Agent (unless it becomes input-active again). Double Agent sends this event only to the client that becomes non-input-active.

This event is signalled when your client application is input-active and the user chooses a another client's in a character's pop-up menu or the Voice Commands window, or you call the method and set the parameter to 0 (). It may also occur when the user selects the name of another character by clicking or speaking. You also get this event when your character is hidden or another character becomes visible.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlDeactivateInputEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlDefaultCharacterChange
member.summary: Signalled when the user changes the default character.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the new default character.

remarks.para: This event indicates that the user has changed the character assigned as the user's default character. Double Agent sends this only to clients that have loaded the default character.
When the new character appears, it assumes the same size as any already loaded instance of the character, or the size of the previous default character (in that order).

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlDefaultCharacterChangeEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlDragComplete
member.summary: Signalled when the user stops dragging a character.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was dragged.
A numeric value that identifies which mouse button was pressed and released to cause the event. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the left button (bit 0) (&H0001), right button (bit 1) (&H0002), and middle button (bit 2) (&H0004). Only one of the bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. If the character has a notification icon, and bit 13 (&H1000) is also set, the click occurred on the notification icon.
A numeric value that corresponds to the state of the Shift, Ctrl, and Alt keys when the mouse button was pressed or released. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the Shift key (bit 0) (&H0001), the Ctrl key (bit 1) (&H0002), and the Alt key (bit 2) (&H0004). A bit is set if the key is down. Some, all, or none of the bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the keys are down. For example, if both Ctrl and Alt were down, the value of would be 6.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user drags a character with no input-active client, Double Agent sets its current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the and CtlDragComplete events.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlDragCompleteEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlDragStart
member.summary: Signalled when the user starts dragging a character.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that's being dragged.
A numeric value that identifies which mouse button was pressed and released to cause the event. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the left button (bit 0) (&H0001), right button (bit 1) (&H0002), and middle button (bit 2) (&H0004). Only one of the bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. If the character has a notification icon, and bit 13 (&H1000) is also set, the click occurred on the notification icon.
A numeric value that corresponds to the state of the Shift, Ctrl, and Alt keys when the mouse button was pressed or released. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the Shift key (bit 0) (&H0001), the Ctrl key (bit 1) (&H0002), and the Alt key (bit 2) (&H0004). A bit is set if the key is down. Some, all, or none of the bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the keys are down. For example, if both Ctrl and Alt were down, the value of would be 6.
The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

remarks.para: This event is sent only to the input-active client of a character. When the user drags a character with no input-active client, Double Agent sets its current input-active client as the last input-active client, sending the event to that client, and then sending the CtlDragStart event.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlDragStartEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlHide
member.summary: Signalled when a character is hidden.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was hidden.
A value that indicates what caused the character to be hidden:
1 = UserHid
The user hid the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
3 = ProgramHid
Your application hid the character.
5 = OtherProgramHid
Another client application hid the character.

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event to all clients of the character. To query the current state of the character, use the property.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlHideEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlListenComplete
member.summary: Signalled when Listening mode (speech recognition) has ended.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the listening character.
The cause of the ListenComplete event.
1 = ProgramDisabled
This program turned off the Listening mode with the method.
2 = ProgramTimedOut
The Listening mode was started by this program with the method, and it timed out.
3 = UserTimedOut
The Listening mode was started with the Listening key, and it timed out.
4 = UserReleasedKey
The Listening mode was started with the Listening key, and the key was released.
5 = UserSpeechEnded
Speech recognition has produced a result.
6 = CharacterClientDeactivated
The character is no longer active or it's active client has changed.
7 = DefaultCharacterChanged
The default character was changed in the Advanced Character Options window.
8 = UserDisabled
Speech recognition was disabled in the Advanced Character Options window.

remarks.para: This event is sent to all clients when the Listening mode time-out ends, after the user releases the Listening key, when the input-active client calls the method with False, or when the user has finished speaking. You can use this event to determine when to resume spoken output.

If you turn on Listening mode using the method and then the user presses the Listening key, the Listening mode resets and continues until the Listening key time-out completes, the Listening key is released, or the user finishes speaking, whichever is later. In this situation, you will not receive a ListenComplete event until the Listening key's mode completes.
The event returns the to the clients that currently have this character loaded. All other clients receive a null (empty string).

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlListenCompleteEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlListenStart
member.summary: Signalled when Listening mode (speech recognition) begins.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the listening character.

remarks.para: This event is sent to all clients when Listening mode begins because the user pressed the Listening key or the input-active client called the method with True. You can use this event to avoid having your character speak while Listening mode is active.

If you turn on Listening mode with the method and then the user presses the Listening key, the Listening mode resets and continues until the Listening key time-out completes, the Listening key is released, or the user finishes speaking, whichever is later. In this situation, when Listening mode is already on, you will not get an additional ListenStart event when the user presses the Listening key.
The event returns the to the clients that currently have this character loaded. All other clients receive a null (empty string).

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlListenStartEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlMove
member.summary: Signalled when a character has moved.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was moved.
The character's new horizontal location, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.
The character's new vertical location, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.
The reason the character moved:
1 = UserMoved
The user dragged the character.
2 = ProgramMoved
Your client application moved the character.
3 = OtherProgramMoved
Another client application moved the character.

remarks.para: This event is signalled when the user or an application changes the character's position. Coordinates are relevant to the upper left corner of the screen. This event is sent only to the clients of the character (applications that have loaded the character).

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlMoveEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlRequestComplete
member.summary: Signalled when Double Agent completes a queued request.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The Object that identifies the completed request.

remarks.para: This event provides a Object. Because requests are processed asynchronously, you can use this event to determine when Double Agent finishes processing a request (such as a , , or method) to synchronize this event with other requests generated by your application. Double Agent sends the event only to the client that created the reference to the Object, and only if you defined a global variable for the request reference.

example.code:
Dim MyRequest Dim Genie
Sub window_Onload control.Characters.Load "Genie","Genie.acs"
Set Genie = control.Characters("Genie")
' This syntax will generate CtlRequestStart and CtlRequestComplete events. Set MyRequest = Genie.Show(False) ' This syntax will not generate CtlRequestStart and CtlRequestComplete events. Genie.Hide False End Sub
Sub control_CtlRequestComplete(ByVal Request) If Request Is MyRequest Then status = "Genie was shown" End Sub

remarks.para: Because animation Objects don't get assigned until Double Agent has queued the request, make sure that the Object exists before you attempt to evaluate it. For example, in Visual Basic, if you use a conditional to test whether a specific request was completed, you can use the Nothing keyword.

example.code: Sub control_CtlRequestComplete (ByVal Request) If Not (MyRequest Is Nothing) Then If Request Is MyRequest Then '-- Do whatever End If End If End Sub

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlRequestCompleteEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlRequestStart
member.summary: Signalled when Double Agent begins a queued request.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The Object that identifies the queued request.

remarks.para: The event provides a Object. Because requests are processed asynchronously, you can use this event to determine when Double Agent begins processing a request (such as a , , or method) and thereby synchronize this with other requests generated by your application. The event is sent only to the client that created the reference to the Object, and only if you defined a global variable for the request reference.

example.code:
Dim MyRequest Dim Genie
Sub window_Onload control.Characters.Load "Genie", "Genie.acs"
Set Genie = control.Characters("Genie")
' This syntax will generate CtlRequestStart and CtlRequestComplete events. Set MyRequest = Genie.Show(False)
' This syntax will not generate CtlRequestStart and CtlRequestComplete events. Genie.Hide False End Sub
Sub control_CtlRequestStart(ByVal Request) If Request Is MyRequest Then status = "Genie is showing" End Sub

remarks.para: The property is 4 (InProgress) for the Object.

Because animation Objects don't get assigned until Double Agent has queued the request, make sure that the Object exists before you attempt to evaluate it. For example, in Visual Basic, if you use a conditional to test whether a specific request was completed, you can use the Nothing keyword.

example.code: Sub control_CtlRequestStart (ByVal Request) If Not (MyRequest Is Nothing) Then If Request Is MyRequest Then '-- Do whatever End If End If End Sub

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlRequestStartEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlShow
member.summary: Signalled when a character is displayed.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the character that was shown.
A value that indicates what caused the character to be shown.
2 = UserShowed
The user showed the character using the command on the character's notification icon or using speech input.
4 = ProgramShowed
Your application showed the character.
6 = OtherProgramShowed
Another client application showed the character.

remarks.para: Double Agent sends this event to all clients of the character. To query the current state of the character, use the property.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlShowEventHandler
member.summary: See the event.

member.name: E:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl.CtlSpeechWord
member.summary: Signalled when the character reaches a new word for the method.
member.param: The source of the event.

A Object that contains the event data:
The unique identifier of the speaking character.
The that's being spoken.
A numeric value that identifies the word that is currently being spoken.

remarks.para: Because events are signalled asynchronously, the synchronization between the speech output and the receipt of this event cannot be exact. However, will generally identify the next word to be spoken.
remarks.note: The parameter may not contain the same reference pointer as the parameter passed to the method, but the underlying data is the same.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent.Button
member.summary: A numeric value that identifies which mouse button was pressed and released to cause the event. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the left button (bit 0) (&H0001), right button (bit 1) (&H0002), and middle button (bit 2) (&H0004). Only one of the bits is set, indicating the mouse button that caused the event. If the character has a notification icon, and bit 13 (&H1000) is also set, the click occurred on the notification icon.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent.CharacterID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the character that was clicked.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent.Shift
member.summary: A numeric value that corresponds to the state of the Shift, Ctrl, and Alt keys when the mouse button was pressed or released. The parameter is a bit field with bits corresponding to the Shift key (bit 0) (&H0001), the Ctrl key (bit 1) (&H0002), and the Alt key (bit 2) (&H0004). A bit is set if the key is down. Some, all, or none of the bits can be set, indicating that some, all, or none of the keys are down. For example, if both Ctrl and Alt were down, the value of would be 6.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent.X
member.summary: The current horizontal location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the left side of the screen.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent.Y
member.summary: The current vertical location of the mouse pointer, in pixels, relative to the top of the screen.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlClickEvent
member.summary: Event arguments for the Event.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlListenCompleteEvent.Cause
member.summary:
The cause of the ListenComplete event.
1 = ProgramDisabled
This program turned off the Listening mode with the method.
2 = ProgramTimedOut
The Listening mode was started by this program with the method, and it timed out.
3 = UserTimedOut
The Listening mode was started with the Listening key, and it timed out.
4 = UserReleasedKey
The Listening mode was started with the Listening key, and the key was released.
5 = UserSpeechEnded
Speech recognition has produced a result.
6 = CharacterClientDeactivated
The character is no longer active or it's active client has changed.
7 = DefaultCharacterChanged
The default character was changed in the Advanced Character Options window.
8 = UserDisabled
Speech recognition was disabled in the Advanced Character Options window.

member.name: F:DoubleAgent.AxControl.CtlListenCompleteEvent.CharacterID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the listening character.

member.name: T:DoubleAgent.AxControl.AxControl
member.summary: The AxControl Object is a managed class that makes the Double Agent control available as a Windows Forms control. It derives from System.Windows.Forms.Control.

remarks.para: The AxControl Object implements the same methods, properties, and events as the Object.

The ActiveX® appearance property names and the event names are prefixed with "Ctl", to avoid name collisions and to make them stand out. Also, the events receive their event data according to the pattern for Windows Forms controls.
